relation: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
pageTitle: iTunes - Music - Dylan (1973) [Remastered] by Bob Dylan
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {17962=It took until the 40th Anniversary of Dylan for it to see the CD/digital format. Released in 1973 by Columbia Records after Bob Dylan signed with David Geffen’s Asylum Records for two albums (Planet Waves, Before The Flood), Dylan consists solely of covers, outtakes from his critically-dismissed 1970 double album Self Portrait and the much better received follow-up New Morning. The album was met with confused and negative reviews upon its release. However, in retrospect, it’s an interesting album with a fair share of worthy curiosities. The cover of Joni Mitchell’s “Big Yellow Taxi” may be a touch too surreal for some ears. But Dylan’s take on Peter LaFarge’s classic “The Ballad of Ira Hayes” is touching, his version of the traditional “Lily of the West” is only arguably marred by its back-up singers and his love for Elvis Presley can be heard on “Can’t Help Falling In Love” and “A Fool Such as I” (though Dylan likely knew the Hank Snow version first), which have that casual sound that Dylan uses for all his endeavors. , 127363=Copyright © 2014 Apple Inc.
